info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 02 at 1:12PM CDT until April 04 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A RED FLAG WARNING IS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY EVENING FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 6% OR LESS, 20FT WINDS OF 30 MPH OR MORE, VERY POOR OVERNIGHT RECOVERY, AND HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER FOR SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO AND MOST OF WEST TEXAS... ...A RED FLAG WARNING IS IN EFFECT FROM MORNING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY EVENING FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 6% OR LESS, 20FT WINDS OF 30 MPH OR MORE, VERY POOR OVERNIGHT RECOVERY, AND HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER FOR SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO AND MOST OF WEST TEXAS... * AFFECTED AREA...Reeves County Plains. * TIMING...Monday morning through late Tuesday evening. * WINDS...Southwest 40 to 50 mph with gusts up to 65 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 3 percent. * RFTI...8 to 9 or extreme. * IMPACTS...This is a particularly dangerous fire weather pattern. Extremely critical fire weather conditions are expected to persist for an extended period with little to no improvement overnight. Avoid the use of open flames or any activities that may generate sparks. Accidental ignitions will have the potential to grow quickly into dangerous wind-driven wildfires.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity and warm temperatures will increase potential for fire growth.
